query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 O voi che siete in piccioletta barca, 2 desiderosi d’ascoltar, seguiti 3 dietro al mio legno che cantando varca,
query.result: 1 O you who are in a tiny boat, 2 eager to listen, follow 3 behind my ship that sails while singing,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
4 tornate a riveder li vostri liti: 5 non vi mettete in pelago, ché forse, 6 perdendo me, rimarreste smarriti.
query.result: 4 turn back to see your shores again: 5 do not put out into the open sea, for perhaps, 6 losing sight of me, you would remain lost.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 L’acqua ch’io prendo già mai non si corse; 8 Minerva spira, e conducemi Appollo, 9 e nove Muse mi dimostran l’Orse.

Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Voialtri pochi che drizzaste il collo 11 per tempo al pan de li angeli, del quale 12 vivesi qui ma non sen vien satollo,
query.result: 10 You other few who turned your neck 11 in good time to the bread of the angels, on which 12 one lives here but does not become sated,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 metter potete ben per l’alto sale 14 vostro navigio, servando mio solco 15 dinanzi a l’acqua che ritorna equale.
query.result: 13 you may indeed set your ship out on the deep sea, 14 keeping to my furrow, 15 ahead of the water that returns as it was.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 Que’ glorïosi che passaro al Colco 17 non s’ammiraron come voi farete, 18 quando Iasón vider fatto bifolco.
query.result: 16 Those glorious ones who sailed to Colchis 17 did not marvel as you will do, 18 when they saw Jason turned plowman.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 La concreata e perpetüa sete 20 del deïforme regno cen portava 21 veloci quasi come ’l ciel vedete.
query.result: 19 The innate and perpetual thirst 20 for the deformed realm bore us along 21 as swiftly as you see the heavens move.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Beatrice in suso, e io in lei guardava; 23 e forse in tanto in quanto un quadrel posa 24 e vola e da la noce si dischiava,

Please translate each line literally into English.
25 giunto mi vidi ove mirabil cosa 26 mi torse il viso a sé; e però quella 27 cui non potea mia cura essere ascosa,
query.result: 25 I saw myself arrived where a wondrous thing 26 turned my face toward it; and therefore she 27 to whom my thoughts could not be hidden,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 volta ver’ me, sì lieta come bella, 29 «Drizza la mente in Dio grata», mi disse, 30 «che n’ha congiunti con la prima stella».
query.result: 28 turned to me, as joyful as she was beautiful, 29 and said, "Direct your mind to God in gratitude, 30 for he has joined us with the first star."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 Parev’ a me che nube ne coprisse 32 lucida, spessa, solida e pulita, 33 quasi adamante che lo sol ferisse.
query.result: 31 It seemed to me that a cloud enveloped us, 32 shining, dense, solid, and polished, 33 like a diamond that the sun strikes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Per entro sé l’etterna margarita 35 ne ricevette, com’ acqua recepe 36 raggio di luce permanendo unita.
query.result: 34 Within itself the eternal pearl 35 received us, as water receives 36 a ray of light while remaining united.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 S’io era corpo, e qui non si concepe 38 com’ una dimensione altra patio, 39 ch’esser convien se corpo in corpo repe,
query.result: 37 If I was corporeal, and here it is not conceivable 38 how one dimension could suffer another, 39 which must be the case if body enters body,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
40 accender ne dovria più il disio 41 di veder quella essenza in che si vede 42 come nostra natura e Dio s’unio.
query.result: 40 that should kindle in us even more the desire 41 to see that essence in which it is seen 42 how our nature and God were united.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
43 Lì si vedrà ciò che tenem per fede, 44 non dimostrato, ma fia per sé noto 45 a guisa del ver primo che l’uom crede.
query.result: 43 There that will be seen which we hold by faith, 44 not demonstrated, but will be known in itself 45 in the manner of the first truth that man believes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 Io rispuosi: «Madonna, sì devoto 47 com’ esser posso più, ringrazio lui 48 lo qual dal mortal mondo m’ha remoto.
query.result: 46 I replied: "My Lady, as devoutly 47 as I can be, I thank him 48 who has removed me from the mortal world.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Ma ditemi: che son li segni bui 50 di questo corpo, che là giuso in terra 51 fan di Cain favoleggiare altrui?».
query.result: 49 But tell me: what are the dark markings 50 of this body, which down there on earth 51 make people tell tales of Cain?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 Ella sorrise alquanto, e poi «S’elli erra 53 l’oppinïon», mi disse, «d’i mortali 54 dove chiave di senso non diserra,
query.result: 52 She smiled a little, and then said to me, "If the opinion 53 of mortals errs, 54 where the key of understanding does not unlock,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 certo non ti dovrien punger li strali 56 d’ammirazione omai, poi dietro ai sensi 57 vedi che la ragione ha corte l’ali.
query.result: 55 certainly the arrows 56 of wonder should no longer pierce you, since you see that reason 57 has its wings clipped behind the senses.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
58 Ma dimmi quel che tu da te ne pensi». 59 E io: «Ciò che n’appar qua sù diverso 60 credo che fanno i corpi rari e densi».
query.result: 58 But tell me what you think of it yourself." 59 And I: "I believe that what appears different up here 60 is caused by the bodies being rare and dense."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 Ed ella: «Certo assai vedrai sommerso 62 nel falso il creder tuo, se bene ascolti 63 l’argomentar ch’io li farò avverso.
query.result: 61 And she: "You will certainly see your belief 62 submerged in error, if you listen well 63 to the argument that I will make against it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 La spera ottava vi dimostra molti 65 lumi, li quali e nel quale e nel quanto 66 notar si posson di diversi volti.
query.result: 64 The eighth sphere shows you many 65 lights, which in their quality and quantity 66 can be noted to be of different aspects.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
67 Se raro e denso ciò facesser tanto, 68 una sola virtù sarebbe in tutti, 69 più e men distributa e altrettanto.
query.result: 67 If rarefaction and density did this so much, 68 there would be only one virtue in all of them, 69 distributed more and less, but equally.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
70 Virtù diverse esser convegnon frutti 71 di princìpi formali, e quei, for ch’uno, 72 seguiterieno a tua ragion distrutti.
query.result: 70 Diverse virtues must be the fruits 71 of formal principles, and those, except for one, 72 would follow from your reasoning to be destroyed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
73 Ancor, se raro fosse di quel bruno 74 cagion che tu dimandi, o d’oltre in parte 75 fora di sua materia sì digiuno
query.result: 73 Furthermore, if that brown color you ask about 74 were caused by rarefaction, or in part from beyond, 75 this planet would be so devoid of its matter

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 esto pianeto, o, sì come comparte 77 lo grasso e ’l magro un corpo, così questo 78 nel suo volume cangerebbe carte.
query.result: 76 or, just as a body distributes 77 the fat and the lean, so this planet 78 would change pages in its volume.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 Se ’l primo fosse, fora manifesto 80 ne l’eclissi del sol, per trasparere 81 lo lume come in altro raro ingesto.
query.result: 79 If the first were the case, it would be evident 80 in the eclipses of the sun, because the light would shine through 81 as in another rarefied body.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
82 Questo non è: però è da vedere 83 de l’altro; e s’elli avvien ch’io l’altro cassi, 84 falsificato fia lo tuo parere.
query.result: 82 This is not the case: therefore we must consider 83 the other; and if it happens that I overturn the other, 84 your opinion will be proven false.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
85 S’elli è che questo raro non trapassi, 86 esser conviene un termine da onde 87 lo suo contrario più passar non lassi;

Please translate each line literally into English.
88 e indi l’altrui raggio si rifonde 89 così come color torna per vetro 90 lo qual di retro a sé piombo nasconde.
query.result: 88 and from there the other's ray is reflected 89 just as color returns through glass 90 which hides lead behind it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 Or dirai tu ch’el si dimostra tetro 92 ivi lo raggio più che in altre parti, 93 per esser lì refratto più a retro.
query.result: 91 Now you will say that the ray appears darker there 92 than in other parts, 93 because it is refracted more obliquely there.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
94 Da questa instanza può deliberarti 95 esperïenza, se già mai la provi, 96 ch’esser suol fonte ai rivi di vostr’ arti.
query.result: 94 Experience can free you from this objection, 95 if you ever try it, 96 which is usually the source of the streams of your arts.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
97 Tre specchi prenderai; e i due rimovi 98 da te d’un modo, e l’altro, più rimosso, 99 tr’ambo li primi li occhi tuoi ritrovi.
query.result: 97 Take three mirrors; and place two of them 98 at the same distance from you, and the other, farther away, 99 so that your eyes are between the first two.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
100 Rivolto ad essi, fa che dopo il dosso 101 ti stea un lume che i tre specchi accenda 102 e torni a te da tutti ripercosso.
query.result: 100 Facing them, arrange that behind your back 101 there is a light that lights up the three mirrors 102 and returns to you reflected by all of them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
103 Ben che nel quanto tanto non si stenda 104 la vista più lontana, lì vedrai 105 come convien ch’igualmente risplenda.
query.result: 103 Although the farthest sight does not extend as much 104 in quantity, you will see there 105 how it is necessary that it shines equally.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 Or, come ai colpi de li caldi rai 107 de la neve riman nudo il suggetto 108 e dal colore e dal freddo primai,
query.result: 106 Now, just as under the blows of the warm rays 107 the subject of the snow remains bare 108 of both its original color and coldness,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
109 così rimaso te ne l’intelletto 110 voglio informar di luce sì vivace, 111 che ti tremolerà nel suo aspetto.
query.result: 109 so I want to inform your intellect, which has remained thus, 110 with such vivid light, 111 that it will tremble at its appearance.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
112 Dentro dal ciel de la divina pace 113 si gira un corpo ne la cui virtute 114 l’esser di tutto suo contento giace.
query.result: 112 Within the heaven of divine peace 113 a body revolves, in whose virtue 114 the being of all its content lies.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
115 Lo ciel seguente, c’ha tante vedute, 116 quell’ esser parte per diverse essenze, 117 da lui distratte e da lui contenute.
query.result: 115 The following heaven, which has so many stars, 116 distributes that being into diverse essences, 117 distinct from it and contained by it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
118 Li altri giron per varie differenze 119 le distinzion che dentro da sé hanno 120 dispongono a lor fini e lor semenze.
query.result: 118 The other circles, through various differences, 119 arrange the distinctions that they have within themselves 120 to their ends and their seeds.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
121 Questi organi del mondo così vanno, 122 come tu vedi omai, di grado in grado, 123 che di sù prendono e di sotto fanno.
query.result: 121 These organs of the world proceed thus, 122 as you now see, from grade to grade, 123 receiving from above and acting below.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
124 Riguarda bene omai sì com’ io vado 125 per questo loco al vero che disiri, 126 sì che poi sappi sol tener lo guado.
query.result: 124 Now look carefully at how I proceed 125 through this place to the truth that you desire, 126 so that afterwards you will know how to keep to the ford alone.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 Lo moto e la virtù d’i santi giri, 128 come dal fabbro l’arte del martello, 129 da’ beati motor convien che spiri;

Please translate each line literally into English.
130 e ’l ciel cui tanti lumi fanno bello, 131 de la mente profonda che lui volve 132 prende l’image e fassene suggello.
query.result: 130 and the heaven that so many lights make beautiful, 131 receives the image from the profound mind that revolves it 132 and makes a seal of itself.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
133 E come l’alma dentro a vostra polve 134 per differenti membra e conformate 135 a diverse potenze si risolve,
query.result: 133 And just as the soul within your dust 134 through different and conforming members 135 resolves itself into diverse faculties,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
136 così l’intelligenza sua bontate 137 multiplicata per le stelle spiega, 138 girando sé sovra sua unitate.
query.result: 136 so its intelligence unfolds its goodness 137 multiplied through the stars, 138 revolving itself upon its unity.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
139 Virtù diversa fa diversa lega 140 col prezïoso corpo ch’ella avviva, 141 nel qual, sì come vita in voi, si lega.
query.result: 139 Diverse virtue forms a diverse alloy 140 with the precious body that it enlivens, 141 in which it is bound, just as life is in you.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
142 Per la natura lieta onde deriva, 143 la virtù mista per lo corpo luce 144 come letizia per pupilla viva.
query.result: 142 Because of the joyful nature from which it derives, 143 the virtue mixed through the body shines 144 like joy through a living pupil.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
145 Da essa vien ciò che da luce a luce 146 par differente, non da denso e raro; 147 essa è formal principio che produce,

148 conforme a sua bontà, lo turbo e ’l chiaro».
query.result: 148 in accordance with its goodness, the dark and the bright."
